title: Authors and Citation
text: Jadey N Ryan. Maintainer, author. Molly McIlquham. Author. Kwabena Sarpong. Author. Leslie Michel. Author. Teal Potter. Author. Deirdre Griffin LaHue. Author. Dani L Gelardi. Author. Washington State Department Agriculture. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ryan JN, McIlquham M, Sarpong KA, Michel L, Potter T, Griffin LaHue D, Gelardi DL. 2023. Visualize Report Soil Health Survey Data {soils}. Washington Soil Health Initiative. https://wa-department--agriculture.github.io/soils/
code: @Article{,   title = {Visualize and Report Soil Health Survey Data with {soils}},   author = {Jadey N Ryan and Molly McIlquham and Kwabena A Sarpong and Leslie Michel and Teal Potter and Deirdre Griffin LaHue and Dani L Gelardi and Washington State Department of Agriculture},   journal = {Washington Soil Health Initiative},   year = {2023},   url = {https://wa-department-of-agriculture.github.io/soils/}, }

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: part Washington Soil Health Initiative, Washington State Department Agriculture Washington State University developed soils soil health data visualization reporting. Inspired ratlas package Spencer Schien’s blog post including Quarto template within R package, soils intended help generate interactive static reports producer land owner participates soil sampling project.

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: repository package work progress.

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: Install development version soils GitHub :

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: Read vignette detailed -. view vignette within RStudio, run command vignette("project", "soils").

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: Read vignette details. view vignette within RStudio, run command vignette("functions", "soils").

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: package can generate static .docx reports interactive .html reports. Read vignette detailed -. view vignette within RStudio, run command vignette("report", "soils"). First page example .docx report Screenshot example .html report

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: Default fonts colors within soils come Washington Soil Health Initiative (WaSHI) branding package washi. allows create beautiful plots, tables, reports box. Throughout soils functions, style sheets, report templates, can customize fonts colors match branding. install, import, register default fonts (Lato headings, Poppins body text), read instructions

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: report template uses Quarto, next-generation version R Markdown. version RStudio must least v2022.07 editing previewing Quarto documents. Though strongly recommended use latest release RStudio. render .docx files, must Microsoft Word installed.

title: Visualize and Report Soil Health Data
text: Soil Health Report Template developed Washington State Department Agriculture Washington State University (WSU) part Washington Soil Health Initiative. Text figures adapted WSU Extension publication #FS378E Soil Health Washington Vineyards.
code: #> To cite soils in publications, please use: #>  #>   Ryan JN, McIlquham M, Sarpong KA, Michel L, Potter T, Griffin LaHue #>   D, Gelardi DL. 2023. A Soil Health Report Template for Survey #>   Studies. Washington Soil Health Initiative. #>   https://wa-department-of-agriculture.github.io/soils/ #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Article{, #>     title = {A Soil Health Report Template for Survey Studies}, #>     author = {Jadey N Ryan and Molly McIlquham and Kwabena A Sarpong and Leslie Michel and Teal Potter and Deirdre Griffin LaHue and Dani L Gelardi and Washington State Department of Agriculture}, #>     journal = {Washington Soil Health Initiative}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     url = {https://wa-department-of-agriculture.github.io/soils/}, #>   }

what: Make strip plot interactive with plotly — make_plotly
title: Make strip plot interactive with plotly — make_plotly
text: Make strip plot interactive plotly

title: Make strip plot interactive with plotly — make_plotly
code: make_plotly(   df,   font_family = "Poppins",   primary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["red"]],   secondary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["ltgray"]],   other_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]],   primary_accent_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["blue"]] )

title: Make strip plot interactive with plotly — make_plotly
text: df Dataframe containing columns: 'category', 'abbr_unit', 'unit', 'dummy', 'sampleLabel'. font_family Font family use throughout plot. Defaults "Poppins". primary_color Color producer's sample points. Defaults WaSHI green. secondary_color Color sample points 'sameCrop' sameCounty' categories. Defaults WaSHI gray. other_color Color sample points project. Defaults WaSHI tan. primary_accent_color Color facet strip background. Defaults WaSHI blue.

title: Make facetted strip plot — make_strip_plot
text: Make facetted strip plot

title: Make facetted strip plot — make_strip_plot
code: make_strip_plot(   df,   output,   font_family = "Poppins",   primary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["red"]],   secondary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["ltgray"]],   other_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]],   primary_accent_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["blue"]] )

title: Make facetted strip plot — make_strip_plot
text: df Dataframe containing columns: 'category', 'abbr_unit', 'unit', 'dummy', 'sampleLabel'. output Type ouput: either "static" "html" font_family Font family use throughout plot. Defaults "Poppins". primary_color Color producer's sample points. Defaults WaSHI green. secondary_color Color sample points 'sameCrop' sameCounty' categories. Defaults WaSHI gray. other_color Color sample points project. Defaults WaSHI tan. primary_accent_color Color facet strip background. Defaults WaSHI blue.

title: Pull unique values from one column of dataframe — pull_unique
text: Vector unique values target column.

title: Pull unique values from one column of dataframe — pull_unique
code: exampleData |>   pull_unique(crop) #>  [1] "Hay/Silage"       "Green Manure"     "Vegetable"        "Herb"             #>  [5] "Pasture, Seeded"  "Cereal Grain"     "Native Land"      "Forest"           #>  [9] "Commercial Tree"  "Berry"            "Orchard"          "Fallow"           #> [13] "CRP/Conservation" "Seed"             "Oilseed"

title: Render producer reports — render_report
text: Render _producerReport.qmd .html .docx files. word document outputs opened manually edited ensure report looks good. See vignette("docx", package = "soils") details edits

title: Render producer reports — render_report
text: producerId Character producerId render report . year Year samples include report. output Target output format. Currently supported options: 'html' interactive report. 'docx' editable word document. '' rendering supported output formats.

title: Render producer reports — render_report
code: if (FALSE) { # Render single html report for first producer in data set first_producer <- head(exampleData$producerId, 1) render_report(   first_producer,   year = 2023,   output = "html" )  # Render docx reports for all 2023 producers unique(exampleData$producerId) |>   purrr::walk(     \(producerId) render_report(       producerId,       year = 2023,       output = "docx",       .progress = TRUE     )   ) }

title: Save plot — save_plot
text: Save plot

title: Save plot — save_plot
text: plot Name plot save. ext File extension type ("png", "svg", etc). height Height plot. width Width plot.

title: Save plot — save_plot
text: Side effects saving plot.

title: Style flextable — style_ft
text: Style flextable

title: Style flextable — style_ft
code: style_ft(   ft,   header_font = "Lato",   body_font = "Poppins",   header_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]],   border_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]] )

title: Style flextable — style_ft
text: ft Flextable object. header_font Font header text. Defaults Lato. body_font Font body text. Defaults Poppins. header_color Background color header cells. Defaults WaSHI green. border_color Color border lines (programmatically darkened selected color). Defaults WaSHI tan.

title: Style flextable — style_ft
text: Styled flextable object.

title: Create a texture triangle — texture_triangle
text: plot requires functions 'prepare_data.R' run first.

title: Create a texture triangle — texture_triangle
code: texture_triangle(   df,   primary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]],   secondary_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["gray"]],   other_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]],   font_family = "Poppins" )

title: Create a texture triangle — texture_triangle
text: df Dataframe containing columns: 'Sand', 'Clay', 'Silt', 'category' primary_color Color producer's sample points Defaults WaSHI green. secondary_color Color sample points 'sameCrop' sameCounty' categories. Defaults WaSHI gray. other_color Color sample points project. Defaults WaSHI tan. font_family Font family use throughout plot. Defaults "Poppins".

title: Create a texture triangle — texture_triangle
text: ggplot texture triangle.
